00036 int set_active_variables(parameters_list *ind) { 
00037 
00038   parameters_list *ptr;
00039   int tmp;
00040   char *str;
00041   ptr = ind; 
00042 
00043   while(ptr != (parameters_list *) 0) {
00044     
00045     //printf("%d\n",ptr->index);
00046     if(ptr->index >= 0) { 
00047       // this variable is active 
00048       input_arr[ptr->index]->isactive = 1;
00049       
00050       // the previous variable represents the derivative
00051       input_arr[ptr->index-1]->isderiv  = 1;
00052 
00053       if(input_arr[ptr->index]->isderiv) { 
00054         printf("$%d cann't be active and deriv in the same time\n",
00055                ptr->index+1);
00056         return 1;
00057       }
00058       
00059       if(input_arr[ptr->index-1]->isactive) { 
00060         printf("$%d cann't be active and deriv in the same time\n",
00061                ptr->index);
00062         return 1;
00063       }
00064     }
00065     else { 
00066       tmp = ptr->index + n_outputs ;
00067       //printf("%d %s\n",tmp,output_arr[tmp]->size);
00068       output_arr[tmp]->isactive = 1;
00069       output_arr[tmp-1]->isderiv = 1;
00070 
00071       if(output_arr[tmp]->isderiv) { 
00072         printf("@%d cann't be active and deriv in the same time\n",
00073                tmp+1);
00074         return 1;
00075       }
00076       
00077       if(output_arr[tmp-1]->isactive) { 
00078         printf("@%d cann't be active and deriv in the same time\n",
00079                tmp);
00080         return 1;
00081       }
00082       
00083     }
00084     ptr = ptr->next ;
00085     
00086   }
00087 
00088   return 0;
00089 }

00093 /*
00094  * Set size of parameters from the macro -size($x,@y,...)=$z
00095  *
00096  * @return 1 failure, 0 success.
00097  */
00098 int set_identical_size(parameters_list *ind, 
00099                         int identical_index) { 
00100 
00101   parameters_list *ptr;
00102   int len;
00103 
00104   /* 
00105    * Set the size  of all parameters whose indeces are allready 
00106    * in ind to the target size  
00107    */ 
00108   ptr = ind;
00109   len = strlen(input_arr[identical_index]->name)+1;
00110   while(ptr != (parameters_list *) 0) { 
00111    
00112     /* if the parameter to be changed is an input */
00113     if(ptr->index >= 0) { 
00114       
00115       /* ensure that we don't set the size of a parameter to it self */
00116       if(ptr->index == identical_index) { 
00117         printf("Conflict : setting size $%d to it self\n", ptr->index); 
00118         yyerror("\n"); 
00119         return 1;
00120       }
00121 
00122       /* ensure that its size  has not been set before */
00123       if(input_arr[ptr->index]->size == (char *) 0)
00124         input_arr[ptr->index]->size = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len); //strlen(input_arr[identical_index]->name);
00125       else { 
00126         printf("$%d size set twice ", ptr->index+1); 
00127         yyerror("\n"); 
00128         return 1;
00129       } 
00130       
00131       /*set its size to the target size */
00132       input_arr[ptr->index]->size = 
00133         strcpy(input_arr[ptr->index]->size,input_arr[identical_index]->name);
00134 
00135     }
00136     /* if the parameter to be changed is an output parameter*/
00137     else { 
00138       /* update to the real index */ 
00139       ptr->index = ptr->index + n_outputs ;
00140        /* ensures that it has not been set before */
00141       if(output_arr[ptr->index]->size == (char *)0 )
00142         output_arr[ptr->index]->size = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00143       else { 
00144         printf("@%d size set twice ", ptr->index+1); 
00145         yyerror("\n"); 
00146         return 1;
00147       }
00148 
00149       output_arr[ptr->index]->size = 
00150         strcpy(output_arr[ptr->index]->size,input_arr[identical_index]->name);
00151       
00152       // update it to the original index
00153       ptr->index = ptr->index - n_outputs ;
00154 
00155     }
00156     ptr = ptr -> next; // repeat with the next target index
00157   }
00158 
00159   return 0;
00160 }

00181    
00182     /* if the parameter to be changed is an input */
00183     if(ptr->index >= 0) { 
00184       
00185       /* ensure that we don't set the type of a parameter to it self */
00186       if(ptr->index == identical_index) { 
00187         printf("Conflict : setting type $%d to it self\n", ptr->index+1); 
00188         yyerror("\n"); 
00189         return 1;
00190       }
00191 
00192       /* ensure that its type  has not been set before */

00197         yyerror("\n"); 
00198         return 1;
00199       }

00202       input_arr[ptr->index]->type = 
00203         strcpy(input_arr[ptr->index]->type,input_arr[identical_index]->name);
00204 
00205     }
00206     /* if the parameter to be changed is an output parameter*/
00207     else { 
00208       /* update to the real index */ 
00209       ptr->index = ptr->index + n_outputs ;
00210        /* ensures that it has not been set before */
00211       if(output_arr[ptr->index]->type == (char *)0 )
00212         output_arr[ptr->index]->type = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00213       else { 
00214         printf("@%d type set twice ", ptr->index+1); 
00215         yyerror("\n"); 
00216         return 1;
00217       }
00218 
00219       output_arr[ptr->index]->type = 
00220         strcpy(output_arr[ptr->index]->type,input_arr[identical_index]->name);
00221       
00222       // update it to the original index
00223       ptr->index = ptr->index - n_outputs ; 
00224       
00225     }
00226     ptr = ptr -> next; // repeat with the next target index
00227   }
00228 
00229   return 0;
00230 }

00235 int set_specific_type(parameters_list* ind,char* str) { 
00236   char *tmp;
00237   int i;
00238   parameters_list* ptr;
00239 
00240   ptr = ind;
00241 
00242   while(ptr != (parameters_list *)0) { 
00243     
00244     if(ptr->index >= 0) { 
00245       tmp = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(str)+1));
00246       tmp = strcpy(tmp,str);
00247       input_arr[ptr->index]->explicit_type = tmp;
00248     }
00249     else { 
00250       i = ptr->index + n_outputs;
00251       tmp = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(str)+1));
00252       tmp = strcpy(tmp,str);
00253       output_arr[i]->explicit_type = tmp;
00254     }
00255 
00256     ptr = ptr->next;
00257   }
00258 
00259   return 0;
00260 }

00262 int set_explicit_size(parameters_list *ind,dimensions_list *list) { 
00263   parameters_list*     ptr;
00264   dimensions_list*  dim;
00265   char *tmp;
00266   int n,i,count;
00267 
00268   ptr   = ind;
00269   dim   = list;
00270   n = dimensions_list_size(list);
00271   
00272   while(ptr != (parameters_list *)0) { 
00273     
00274     if(ptr->index >= 0) { 
00275       input_arr[ptr->index]->ndims = n;
00276       input_arr[ptr->index]->dims = (char **) malloc( sizeof(char *) * n);
00277       count = n-1;
00278       while(dim != (dimensions_list *) 0) { 
00279         tmp = (char *) malloc((strlen(dim->str)+1)*sizeof(char));
00280         tmp = strcpy(tmp,dim->str);
00281         input_arr[ptr->index]->dims[count--] = tmp;
00282         dim = dim->next;
00283       }
00284     }
00285     else {
00286       i = ptr->index + n_outputs;
00287       output_arr[i]->ndims = n;
00288       output_arr[i]->dims = (char **) malloc( sizeof(char *) * n);
00289       count = n-1;
00290       while(dim != (dimensions_list *) 0) { 
00291          tmp = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(dim->str)+1));
00292          tmp = strcpy(tmp,dim->str);
00293          output_arr[i]->dims[count--] = tmp;
00294          dim = dim->next;
00295        }
00296     }
00297     dim = list;
00298     ptr = ptr->next;
00299   }
00300 
00301   return 0;
00302 }

00311 int set_explicit_outputs(parameters_list* ind) { 
00312   parameters_list*     ptr;
00313   
00314   ptr = ind;
00315   while(ptr != (parameters_list *)0) { 
00316     output_arr[ptr->index]->explicit_allocate = 1;
00317     ptr = ptr->next;
00318   }
00319   return 0;
00320 }

00323 void set_default_type() { 
00324   int i,k;
00325   char *tmp;
00326   argument *ptr;
00327 
00328   for(i=0; i < n_inputs; i++) 
00329     if( (input_arr[i]->type == (char *) 0) && 
00330         (input_arr[i]->explicit_type == (char *) 0)) 
00331       { 
00332         tmp = (char *) malloc( sizeof(char) * 10);
00333         tmp = strcpy(tmp,"double");
00334         input_arr[i]->explicit_type = tmp;
00335       }
00336 
00337   for(i=0; i < n_outputs; i++) 
00338     if ( (output_arr[i]->type == (char *) 0) && 
00339          (output_arr[i]->explicit_type == (char *) 0))
00340       { 
00341         tmp = (char *) malloc( sizeof(char) * 10);
00342         tmp = strcpy(tmp,"double");
00343         output_arr[i]->explicit_type = tmp;
00344       }
00345 
00346   for(i=0;i<n_inputs;i++) {  
00347     ptr = input_arr[i]; 
00348     tmp = ptr->explicit_type;
00349     
00350     while(tmp == (char *) 0) {
00351       if(ptr->explicit_type != (char *) 0) { 
00352         tmp = (char *) malloc( sizeof(char) * 100);
00353         tmp = strcpy(tmp,ptr->explicit_type);
00354         input_arr[i]->explicit_type = tmp;
00355       }
00356       else { 
00357         k = search_input(ptr->type);
00358         if(k >= 0)
00359           ptr = input_arr[k];
00360         else { 
00361           printf("confilict with explicit type and type\n");
00362           exit(1);
00363         }
00364       }
00365     }
00366   }
00367 
00368   for(i=0;i<n_outputs;i++) {  
00369     ptr = output_arr[i]; 
00370     tmp = ptr->explicit_type;
00371     
00372     while(tmp == (char *) 0) {
00373       if(ptr->explicit_type != (char *) 0) { 
00374         tmp = (char *) malloc( sizeof(char) * 100);
00375         tmp = strcpy(tmp,ptr->explicit_type);
00376         output_arr[i]->explicit_type = tmp;
00377       }
00378       else { 
00379         k = search_input(ptr->type);
00380         if(k >= 0)
00381           ptr = input_arr[k];
00382         else { 
00383           printf("confilict with explicit type and type\n");
00384           exit(1);
00385         }
00386       }
00387     }
00388   }
00389 
00390 }

00392 void set_default_size() { 
00393   int i;
00394   char* str;
00395  
00396   for(i=0;i<n_outputs;i++)
00397     if( (output_arr[i]->size == (char *)0) && 
00398         (output_arr[i]->ndims == 0) && 
00399         (!output_arr[i]->isderiv)) 
00400       { 
00401         output_arr[i]->ndims = 2;
00402         output_arr[i]->dims = (char **) malloc(sizeof(char *) * 2);
00403         
00404         str = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)* 3);
00405         str = strcpy(str,"1");  
00406         output_arr[i]->dims[0] = str;
00407       
00408         str = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)* 3);
00409         str = strcpy(str,"1");  
00410         output_arr[i]->dims[1] = str;
00411       }
00412   
00413 }
00414 
00420 void update_identical_parameters() { 
00421   int i,j,len;
00422   
00423 /* set the size & type of arguments having identical names */
00424   for(i=0; i<n_inputs; i++) { 
00425 
00426     /*if the input argument is not named */
00427     if(!strcmp(input_arr[i]->name,"")) { 
00428       set_default_input_name(input_arr[i]);
00429       // default type is always double 
00430       continue ;
00431     }
00432     len = strlen(input_arr[i]->name)+1;
00433     
00434     /* update the size & type & names of inputs of similar names  */ 
00435     for(j = i+1;j<n_inputs;j++) { 
00436       /*if  argument i & j have identical name */
00437       if(!strcmp(input_arr[i]->name,input_arr[j]->name)) { 
00438         /*set the size & type of argument j*/
00439 
00440         input_arr[j]->size = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00441         input_arr[j]->type = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00442         input_arr[j]->size =  strcpy(input_arr[j]->size,
00443                                      input_arr[i]->name);
00444         input_arr[j]->type =  strcpy(input_arr[j]->type,
00445                                      input_arr[i]->name);
00446 
00447         /* change the name of argument j*/
00448         set_default_input_name(input_arr[j]);
00449         
00450       }
00451     } // for j inputs 
00452      
00453     for(j=0; j<n_outputs; j++) { 
00454      
00455       if(!strcmp(input_arr[i]->name,output_arr[j]->name)) {
00456         /*update the size & type of argument j*/
00457         output_arr[j]->size = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00458         output_arr[j]->type = (char *) malloc(sizeof(char)*len);
00459         output_arr[j]->size =  strcpy(output_arr[j]->size,
00460                                       input_arr[i]->name);
00461         output_arr[j]->type =  strcpy(output_arr[j]->type,
00462                                      input_arr[i]->name);
00463         /*update the type of the argument j*/
00464 
00465         /* change the name of argument j*/
00466         set_default_output_name(output_arr[j]);
00467       }
00468     } // for j outputs 
00469   
00470   } // for i 
00471 
00472 }
